nodes.bodyText: nit: let's keep hostname and port so in the logger and exception we can print host and port out.
you could also use the getRemoteHost() and getRemotePort() methods in this class to construct log messages, which look it up from the channel pool
nit: better to print out host and port.
nit: I am seeing this pr ignores some stats handlers from Http2NetworkClient, it would be nice to have those stats in place even for replication.

3 seconds seems a bit arbitrary, and awaitUninterruptibly returns a boolean indicating if the write succeeded or not. If the return value is false, we should throw out some exception so the caller would not proceeds to call receive method.
I would suggest making the send, receive and connection checkout timeouts configurable like in ConnectionPoolConfig.
I think we should also override exceptionCaught method and set and error to the promise. So we don't have to wait for 3 seconds if something is wrong.
nit: might as well capture all the Exception.
Wait on future for shutdown to complete here?
nit: after getAndSet() maybe check if the returned value is null.
this should also have a null check in case exceptionCaught called getAndSet first
why does this class use ConcurrentHashMap instead of Http2ChannelPoolMap?
